titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Hartt School phonograph records ARCH138
titlestmt.author: started by Ethel Bacon (and possibly Margaret Mair); transcribed to ArchivesSpace from word document finding aid by Tiffany Crawford, Jan. 2016; completed and revised by Sean Parke, Dec. 2019.

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Hartford Archives & Special Collections

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-12-04 09:41:22 -0500.

change.item: Completed processing of all recordings, and updated finding aid

repository.corpname: University of Hartford Archives & Special Collections

did.unittitle: Hartt School phonograph records
did.abstract: The Hartt School phonograph records is a collection of phonograph records collected by the Hartt School which pertain to the school and its students, faculty, and alumni.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to all researchers.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials in this collection may be protected by copyright law (U.S. Code: Title 17). Any use of the material which exceeds fair use requires permission from the copyright holder. Researchers are solely responsible for obtaining the proper permission(s) for their use of the material.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection has been processed by many people over the years, starting with Ethel Bacon, likely continued by Margaret Mair, and finished by Sean Parke (Dec. 2019).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Hartt School phonograph records consists of phonograph recordings which feature Hartt School students, faculty, and alumni as performers, conductors, and/or composers in recordings from 1938-1986. The collection was initially started by Moshe Paranov, and has been added to over the years. Recordings include Hartt ensembles, albums featuring Hartt faculty and alumni, as well as radio, festival, and other live recorded performances. The live recorded events oftentimes feature Moshe Paranov as the conductor and are frequently for non-Hartt School ensembles. Some recordings in the collection were accompanied with materials such as programs, newspaper clippings, correspondence, performer information, and other ephemera.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into three series: I. Phonograph Records, II. Ephemera, and III. Duplicates.

controlaccess.subject: Hartt College of Music -- Alumni and Alumnae

did.unittitle: Phonograph Recordings

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Phonograph Recordings series, makes up the majority of the collection and consists of various phonograph records retained by the Hartt School. These recorded performances are often either performed, conducted, and/or composed by Hartt faculty, students, and alumni. However, in some rare cases, no known relationship exists between the performers, conductors, or composers and the Hartt School. This series includes the original record covers (when available), but does not include ephemera that was found with some of the recordings. These items are located in the Ephemera series.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged into four subseries by disc size: a) 7-inch and 8-inch Phonograph Recordings, b) 10-inch Phonograph Recordings, c) 12-inch Phonograph Recordings, and d) 16-inch Transcription Discs.

did.unittitle: 7-inch and 8-inch Phonograph Records
California State College at Long Beach and State University College at Fredonia, New York Clarinet Choirs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record from the Kendor Ensemble Series released by Kendor Music, Inc. (35443). Side one features the California State College at Long Beach Clarinet Choir, conducted by Charles D. Yates performing Untitled Poem by John Rarig. Side two features the State University College at Fredonia, New York Clarinet Choir, conducted by William C. Willett (Hartt faculty) performing Clarinetics by Klauss.

did.unittitle: Folk Music Lecture
Mannes School Orchestra; Gagliarda

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the Mannes School Orchestra, conducted by Carl Bamberger, performing Gagliarda by Alvin L. Epstein (Hartt faculty) on May 28, 1952.

did.unittitle: Unidentified [W. Willet?]
10-inch Phonograph Records
Arnold Franchetti, Game of Cards
Hartt Symphony Orchestra, Spring Choral Festival
Mollen Hauer, Fantasia
Irene Kahn and Moshe Paranov (Dual Pianists), Chess Seranade
Suzanne Kirby, performed by Earl Rogers and Annabel Briett
Massachusetts All-State Orchestra
Ted Melyan, Bagatelle
Ted Melyan, Soliloquy
New York Sectional Orchestra
NYSSMA All-State Orchestra
NYSSMA All-State Orchestra
Putche
Rieding, First Movt. Concerto
Freidrich Schorr; Shumann Liederkreis, Opus 39
12-inch Phonograph Records

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged alphabetically by the last name of the primary performer, or when appropriate by the primary ensemble or event name.

did.unittitle: All-Connecticut Music Festival

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonographs record of the All-Connecticut Music Festival on October 25, 1968 featuring orchestra, chorus, and band (with orchestra conducted by Moshe Paranov).

did.unittitle: All-Maryland High School Orchestra and Chorus

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One phonograph record of the All-Maryland High School Orchestra (guest conducted by Moshe Paranov) and Chorus on October 20, 1972.

did.unittitle: All-Suffolk Junior High School Orchestra and Chorus

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two phonograph records of the 1958 All-Suffolk Junior High School Orchestra and Chorus (orchestra conducted by Moshe Paranov).

did.unittitle: American Festival of Music

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the 1958 American Festival of Music performance of Suite for Piano by Jeremy Joyce Laverne, performed by Marcia Heller.

did.unittitle: Harold Bauer; Harold Bauer Plays Chopin

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One phonograph record of the album Harold Bauer plays Chopin featuring Harold Bauer, released by Klavier Record Company (KS-113).

did.unittitle: Harold Bauer; Johannes Brahms, Sonata in F Minor, Op. 5

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Four phonograph records of Harold Bauer performing Sonata in F Minor, Op. 5 by Johannes Brahms. Record by Schirmer's Library of Recorded Music, Set No. 14.

did.unittitle: Harold Bauer; Moonlight Sonata and Gavotte in F Major

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two phonograph records of Harold Bauer performing Moonlight Sonata and Gavotte in F Major by Ludwig van Beethoven. Recording by RCA Victor Company (6591-A/B and 6592-A/B).

did.unittitle: Harold Bauer; Schumann, Fantasiestucke (Opus 12)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Four phonograph records of Harold Bauer performing Robert Schumann's Fantasiestucke (Opus 12).Recording by RCA Victor Company (14487-A/B through 14489-A/B).

did.unittitle: Harold Bauer and Alfred Cohen

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of Harold Bauer and Alfred Cohen performing Flourish and Ye Sweet Retreat, recorded by WTIC.

did.unittitle: Melvin Berman with Kelsey Jones and Walter Joachim; Vivaldi, Il Pastor Fido - Six Sonatas Op. 13 for Oboe and Continuo

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of Vivaldi's Il Pastor Fido - Six Sonatas Op. 13 for Oboe and Continuo performed by Melvin Berman with Kelsey Jones and Walter Joachim. Recorded in Church of St. John the Evangelist, Montreal. Released by Everest Records Production (2875).

did.unittitle: Ernest Bloch; Sacred Service (Avodath Hakodesh)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of Ernest Bloch conducting his piece Sacred Service (Avodath Hakodesh) performed by Marko Rothmuller, Dorothy Bond, Doris Cowan with the London Philharmonic Choir and London Philharmonic Orchestra. Released by the London Gramophone Corporation (London Record, LLP 123).

did.unittitle: Brockton [Orchestral Society?]; Farm Journal

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two phonograph records of what is believed to be the Brockton Orchestral Society, performing Farm Journal.

did.unittitle: Brockton Orchestral Society; Stars and Stripes Forever

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the Brockton Orchestral Society, performing Stars and Stripes Forever by John Philip Sousa.

did.unittitle: Marçal Cervera and Rafael Puyana; Johann Sebastian Bach: 3 Sonaten Für Viola de Gamba & Cembalo

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the album Johann Sebastian Bach: 3 Sonaten Für Viola de Gamba & Cembalo released by Philips (9502 003), featuring Marçal Cervera and Rafael Puyana (Hartt alumnus).

did.unittitle: Vincent Coffin; Juke Box Jingles

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record labelled as "VIP disc. Vincent Coffin, chairman of the 1952 drive, Juke Box Jingles." It is unclear what Vincent Coffin's role in the recording, if any. It is also not clear how this recording relates to the recording "Moshe Paranov, Juke Box Jingles, 1952 Feb 8." Both recordings were made by WTIC.

did.unittitle: Connecticut All-State Band

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the Connecticut All-State Band on October 28, 1954.

did.unittitle: The Contemporary Chamber Players of the University of Chicago

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph records of the Contemporary Chamber Players of the University of Chicago, conducted by Ralph Shapey, performing The Cat and the Moon by Thomas Putsché (Hartt faculty), Requiems for the Party-Girl by R. Murray Schafer, and Cantus Commemorabilias I by Henry Weinberg. Album released by Composers Recordings (CRI SD 245) in 1969.

did.unittitle: Mario Davidovsky and Barbara Kolb

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of Synchronisms No. 6, Electronic Study No. 3, and Synchronisms No. 5 composed by Mario Davidovsky, and Trobar Clus and Solitaire for Piano and Vibes composed by Barbara Kolb (Hartt alumnae). Albulm released by Turnabout Vox (TV-S 34487).

did.unittitle: Luiz De Moura Castro; Schumann, Liszt, Ginastera, and de Falla

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of extracts of Luiz de Moura Castro's performance of Arabesque, Opus 18 (Schumann), Sonata in B Minor (Liszt), Suite de Danzas Criollas (Ginastera), and Ritual Fire Dance (from El Amor Brujo) (de Falla) on October 2, 1984 at Merkin Concert Hall, Abraham Goodman House. Album released by Educo Records (3157).

did.unittitle: Luiz De Moura Castro; Villa-Lobos and Liszt

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of Luiz de Moura Castro performing Lenda Do Coboclo, Choros No. 5, Aria from Bachianas Brasileiras No. 4, Impressoes Seresteiras, Dansa Do Indio Branco by Heitor Villa-Lobos and Ave Maria, St. Francis of Paola Walking on the Waters, Funerailles by Franz Liszt. Album released by Educo Records (3118).

did.unittitle: Alfred Drake, Roberta Peters; Carousel, with Claramae Turner, Lee Venora, Norman Treigle, and Jon Crain

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the album Carousel featuring Alfred Drake and Roberta Peters, with Claramae Turner, Lee Venora (Hartt alumnae), Norman Treigle, and Jon Crain. Album released by Grand Award Record Company (RS 843 SD).

did.unittitle: Eastern Division Connecticut Music Educators' Association Concert Festival

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the Third Eastern Division Connecticut Music Educators' Association Concert Festival at Jorgenson Auditorium at the University of Connecticut on January 30, 1965. Orchestra conducted by Moshe Paranov.

did.unittitle: Eastern Division Connecticut Music Educators Association Concert Festival

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the Fourth Eastern Division Connecticut Music Educators Association Concert Festival at the University of Connecticut on January 29, 1966. Orchestra conducted by Moshe Paranov.

did.unittitle: Eastern Division Music Educators' National Conference Concert

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two phonograph records of the Eastern Division Music Educators' National Conference Concert with All-Eastern High School orchestra, chorus, and band on February 10-13, 1967. The orchestra was conducted by Moshe Paranov.

did.unittitle: Arnold Franchetti; Three Italian Masques - and Hunter Johnson; Trio for Flute, Oboe and Piano

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of Arnold Franchetti's Three Italian Masques: Concertino for Piano, Brass, Percussion and Bass featuring Raymond Hanson (piano, Hartt faculty)); the New York Brass Ensemble; Robert Nagel, John Glasel, and Ted Weis (trumpets); Keith Brown and David Uber (trombones); Stuart Sankey (bass); Ronald Gould (percussion); and Samuel Baron (conductor). Record also includes Hunter Johnson's Trio for Flute, Oboe and Piano with Julius Baker (flute), Robert Bloom (oboe), and Douglas Nordli (piano). Album released by Composers Recordings, Inc. (CRI-125).

did.unittitle: Alfred C. Fuller; Address to the Rotary Club of Los Angeles

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Three phonograph records of an address by Alfred C. Fuller to the Rotary Club of Los Angeles, California at the Biltmore Hotel.

did.unittitle: Raya Garbousova; Cello Melodies

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Three phonograph records of the album Cello Melodies performed by Raya Garbousova. Album released by RCA Victor Company (11-8869-A/B through 11-8871-A/B).

did.unittitle: Leopold Godowsky; Columbia Record Symphony Series

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of Leopold Godowsky (piano) performing Gondoliera in G Flat, and If I Were a Bird Op.2, No. 6 by Hanselt, as well as Waltz by Chopin. Album released by Columbia Graphophone Company (A5791).

did.unittitle: Caren Goodin and Stephen Glover

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One phonograph record released by the International Piano Library (IPL 1001) featuring Caren Goodin (Hartt alumnae) performing Moszkowski's Piano Concerto with a symphony orchestra and Stephen Glover performing Godowsky's Passacaglia.

did.unittitle: Hartt College of Music Chamber and Madrigal Singers; MENC Eastern Division Concert

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the Hartt College of Music Chamber and Madrigal Singers performing at the MENC Eastern Division Concert in Washington, D.C. on January 30, 1969. Directed by Gerald Mack with organist Richard Matteson.

did.unittitle: Hartt College of Music Summer Youth Music Program Concert

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the Hartt College of Music Summer Youth Music Program Concert in 1968. Orchestra conducted by Moshe Paranov, chorus conducted by Gerald Mack, and band conducted by Donald Mattran.

did.unittitle: Hartt College of Music Summer Youth Concert

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two phonograph records of the Hartt College of Music Summer Youth Concert in 1971. Conducted by Moshe Paranov, Gerald Mack, Donald Mattran, and William Willett, with guest members William Elwell and Janice Gibeau.

did.unittitle: Hartt College of Music Summer Youth Concert

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two phonograph records of the Hartt College of Music Summer Youth Music Program Concert in 1972. Orchestra conducted by Moshe Paranov, chorus conducted by Gerald Mack, and band conducted by Donald Mattran.

did.unittitle: Hartt College of Music Summer Youth Concert, Record 2

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the Hartt College of Music Summer Youth Music Program Concert in 1974. The phonograph is labelled as Record Two and only contains recordings of the Orchestra, the Archives does not have Record One. The orchestra was conducted by Moshe Paranov.

did.unittitle: Hartt College Symphony Orchestra; MENC Eastern Division Concert

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the Hartt College Symphony Orchestra at the MENC Eastern Division Concert at Washington, D.C. in 1969. Conducted by Nathan Gottschalk, the concert includes performances of Roman Carnival Overture by Hector Berlioz, Sinfonietta for String Orchestra, by Edward Miller (Hartt Faculty), and Symphonic Metamorphosis of Themes by Carl Maria Von Weber by Paul Hindemith.

did.unittitle: Hartt Opera Guild?; Hansel and Gretel

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of an opera production of Hansel and Gretel most likely performed by the Hartt Opera Guild.

did.unittitle: Hartt Opera Guild; Marriage of the Devil

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Five phonograph records of the Hartt Opera Guild's production of Marriage of the Devil.

did.unittitle: Hartt Opera Guild; The Secret of Suzanne

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Four phonograph records of the Hartt Opera Guild's production of The Secret of Suzanne.

did.unittitle: Hartt Opera Guild; Sister Angelica

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Four phonograph records of the Hartt Opera Guild's production of Sister Angelica.

did.unittitle: Hartt Symphony Orchestra

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the Hartt Symphony Orchestra on March 27, 1955.

did.unittitle: Hartt Youth Symphonic Band

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two phonograph records of the Hartt Youth Symphonic Band, conducted by Samuel Goldfarb, on February 8, 1971.

did.unittitle: Irene Jacobi and the Coolidge Quartet; Frederick Jacobi, Hagiographa

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Three phonograph records of Frederick Jacobi's Hagiographa: Three Biblical Narratives (For String Quartet and Piano), performed by Irene Jacobi (piano) and the Coolidge Quartet, featuring William Kroll (1st violin and Hartt Faculty), Nicolai Berezowsky (2nd violin), Nicolas Moldavan (viola), and Victor Gottlieb (cello). Album released by RCA Victor (18005-S through 18007-A/B).

did.unittitle: Milada Javora and Marie Bradac; Koleda: Czech and Slovak Christmas Carols

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of album released by Gamut Records (Hartford, CT) Koleda: Czech and Slovak Christmas Carols sung by Milada Javora (Hartt Faculty) and Marie Bradac, with organist Godfrey Tomanek.

did.unittitle: Junior High School Music Festival Concert

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two phonograph records of the Nineteenth Annual Junior High School Music Festival Concert held in North Babylon, New York on March 3, 1973. Orchestra conducted by Moshe Paranov.

did.unittitle: Gary Karr with Jeffrey Siegel; Gary Karr Plays Double Bass

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the album Gary Karr Plays Double Bass released by Golden Crest (Recital Series RE-7012), featuring Gary Karr (Hartt faculty) with Jeffrey Siegel (piano).

did.unittitle: Daniel Kobialka with Myron Press; Daniel Kobialka, violinist, Plays Music of Kirchner, Cheney, Bavicchi

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the album Daniel Kobialka, violinist, Plays Music of Kirchner, Cheney, and Bavicchi released by Medea Records (MCLP1002), featuring Daniel Kobialka (Hartt alumnus) with Myron Press (piano).

did.unittitle: Enid Katahn; Keys

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the album Keys released by Peacetree Records, featuring Enid Katahn (pianist and Hartt alumnae). The record cover includes a signed inscription from Enid to Moshe Paranov.

did.unittitle: Igor Kipnis, Jay Gottlieb, and Ensemble InterContemporain; Barbara Kolb: Toccata, Appello, Soundings

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the album Barbara Kolb released by Composers Recordings Incorporated (CRI SD 537) in 1986, featuring three pieces composed by Barbara Kolb (Hartt alumnae): Toccata performed by Igor Kipnis (harpsichord), Appello performed by Jay Gottlieb (piano), and Soundings performed by Ensemble InterContemporain and conducted by Arturo Tamayo. The record cover includes a signed inscription from Kolb to Sam Berkman and Irene Kahn.

did.unittitle: Jacob Lateiner; Brahms

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the album Brahms released by Westminster Recording (XWN 18870), featuring Jacob Lateiner (piano – Hartt faculty) performing Variations and Fugue on a Theme of Handel, Op. 24 and Variations on a Theme of Paganini, Op. 35.

did.unittitle: Laurel Music Camp Orchestra

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the Laurel Music Camp Orchestra on July 2, 1954, conducted by Moshe Paranov.

did.unittitle: Laurel Music Camp Concert

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the Laurel Music Camp performance on July 2, 1965. Chorus conducted by John Raymond, band conducted by John Corley, and orchestra conducted by Moshe Paranov.

did.unittitle: Laurel Music Camp Concert

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the Laurel Music Camp performance on July 1, 1966. Chorus conducted by John Raymond, band conducted by John Corley, and orchestra conducted by Moshe Paranov.

did.unittitle: Laurel Music Camp Concert

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the 24th Annual Laurel Music Camp Concert on June 28, 1968. Chorus conducted by Moshe Paranov, band conducted by Stanley Hettinger, and orchestra conducted by Michael Semanitsky.

did.unittitle: Laurel Music Camp Concert

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the 27th Annual Laurel Music Camp Concert on July 2, 1971. Chorus conducted by John Raymond, band conducted by Moshe Paranov, and orchestra conducted by Rouben Gregorian.

did.unittitle: Levittown Sectional All-State Concert

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the Levittown Sectional All-State Concert on November 17, 1956 in Levittown, NY. Orchestra conducted by Moshe Paranov.

did.unittitle: Humbert Lucarelli, with Gerald Tarack, Thomas Grubb, and the New Art String Trio; Britten

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the album Britten released by Lyrichord Stereo (LLST 7195), featuring Humbert Lucarelli (oboe – Hartt faculty), with Gerald Tarack (violin), Thomas Grubb (piano), and the New Art String Trio (with Gerald Tarack – violin, Jean Dupouy – viola, and Alexander Kouguell – cello), performing Benjamin Britten's Six Metamorphoses after Ovid, Opus 49; Suite for Violin and Piano, Opus 6; and Phantasy Quartet, Opus 2.

did.unittitle: Bert Lucarelli; The Sensual Sound of the Soulful Oboe

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the album The Sensual Sound of the Soulful Oboe: With Guitars, Strings, and Percussion released by Jonella Record Company (JRC-1), featuring Humbert "Bert" Lucarelli (oboe – Hartt faculty).

did.unittitle: Massachusetts All-State Chorus and Orchestra

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Three phonograph records of the Massachusetts All-State Chorus and Orchestra performing on February 17, 1951. Orchestra conducted by Moshe Paranov.

did.unittitle: Robert Maxwell; The Broadcaster: A Symphonic Suite

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of The Broadcaster: A Symphonic Suite, composed and conducted by Robert Maxwell on November 27, 1961 for the dedication of Broadcast House (WTIC TV-AM-FM, Hartford, CT) following the unveiling by Governor John N. Dempsey of the bronze statue called "The Broadcaster."

did.unittitle: NBC; Old Maid and the Thief

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Eight phonograph records of the NBC production of Old Maid and the Thief recorded on April 22, 1939.

did.unittitle: New England All-State Orchestra

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the New England All-State Orchestra recorded on March 24, 1956 under the conduction of Moshe Paranov.

did.unittitle: New England Festival Orchestra and Chorus

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the New England Festival Orchestra and Chorus recorded on March 23, 1957. Orchestra conducted by Moshe Paranov.

did.unittitle: New England Preparatory School Music Festival Chorus, with the Cambridge Festival Orchestra

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the New England Preparatory School Music Festival Chorus, with the Cambridge Festival Orchestra, recorded April 1964. Orchestra conducted by Nathan Gottschalk.

did.unittitle: New York Sectional Orchestra

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two phonograph records of the New York Sectional Orchestra performing Pop Goes the Weasel and Symphony in F, performed on November 21, 1953.

did.unittitle: NYSSMA All-State Orchestra

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two phonograph records of the New York State School Music Association (NYSSMA) All-State Orchestra performing The Last Spring, London Symphony, and Pop Goes the Weasel on November 17, 1951.

did.unittitle: NYSSMA All-State Orchestra

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Three phonograph records of the New York State School Music Association (NYSSMA) All-State Orchestra performing Pop Goes the Weasel, Farm Journal Suite, Gallop, and The Last String on December 5, 1953.

did.unittitle: NYSSMA Festival Concert Eastern Division of the Music Educators National Conference

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two phonograph records of the New York State School Music Association (NYSSMA) Festival Concert Eastern Division of the Music Educators National Conference recorded February 4-8, 1965. Orchestra conducted by Moshe Paranov.

did.unittitle: NYSSMA Music Festival

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two phonograph records of the 1969 New York State School Music Association (NYSSMA) Music Festival. Orchestra conducted by Moshe Paranov.

did.unittitle: NYSSMA Suffolk Sectional Music Festival

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two phonograph records of the New York State School Music Association (NYSSMA) Suffolk Sectional Music Festival on November 19, 1966.

did.unittitle: Russell Oberlin and Joseph Iadone; John Dowland: Lute Songs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the album John Dowland: Lute Songs released in 1958 by Experiences Anonymes (EA-0034), featuring Russell Oberlin (countertenor) and Joseph Iadone (lute – Hartt Faculty).

did.unittitle: Paul Olefsky and Walter Hautzig; Sonatas for Cello and Piano

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the album Sonatas for Cello and Piano released circa 1969 by Monitor Records (MC 2116/MCS 2116), featuring Paul Olefsky (cello) and Walter Hautzig (piano) performing Brahm's Sonata in E Minor, Op. 38 for Cello and Piano and Sonata in F Major, Op. 99 for Cello and Piano. The record cover includes a signed inscription from Olefsky to Moshe Paranovn dated March 25, 1969.

did.unittitle: Moshe Paranov; Juke Box Jingles

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph recording of Juke Box Jingles by Moshe Paranov, recorded by WTIC on February 8, 1952.

did.unittitle: Moshe Paranov and Supporting Cast; WTIC recording

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of Moshe Paranov and a supporting cast, conducted by Moshe Paranov, recorded by WTIC on November 4, 1938.

did.unittitle: Frank Pettingell; Dickens Duets

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the album Dickens Duets read by Frank Pettingell, produced/directed by Arthur Luce Klein, and released by Spoken Arts (741).

did.unittitle: Richard Provost; Guitar: Old and New World

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the album Guitar: Old and New World released in 1969 by Ars Nova-Ars Antiqua (LCCN R68-3570), featuring Richard Provost (guitar – Hartt faculty) performing Suite No. 3 in D Minor by Robert De Visée (first recording), Sonata No. 2 Op. 15 by Fernando Sor, Sonatina Op. 51 by Lennox Berkeley, and Sonata by Alexander Bellow (first recording). Recording engineer was Nina Paranov Fagan.

did.unittitle: Thomas Putsche; In the Dark Pine Wood

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph recording of In the Dark Pine Wood by Thomas Putsche.

did.unittitle: Florica Remetier and the Hartt Symphony

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph recording of Florica Remetier and the Hartt Symphony, conducted by Moshe Paranov, recorded on March 27, 1955.

did.unittitle: Saint Ann's Church Choir; Rejoice

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the album Rejoice released Circa 1962 by MZ Records (MZLP 5002), featuring Saint Ann's Church Choir.

did.unittitle: Donald Sinta with Nelita True; American Music

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the album American Music released in 1965 by Mark Educational Recordings (MRS 22868), featuring Donald Sinta (alto saxophone – Hartt faculty) with Nelita True (piano).

did.unittitle: Spring Choral Festival of Secondary Schools with Hartt Symphony Orchestra; The Messiah

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph recording of the Spring Choral Festival of Secondary Schools, with the Hartt Symphony Orchestra on April 27, 1958 at the Bushnell Memorial Hall, performing The Messiah by George Frederick Handel with Moshe Paranov conducting.

did.unittitle: Spring Choral Festival of Secondary Schools with Hartt Symphony Orchestra

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph recording of the Spring Choral Festival of Secondary Schools, with the Hartt Symphony Orchestra on April 30, 1961 at the Bushnell Memorial Hall, performing The Sons of Light by Ralph Vaughan Williams and Litany in B Flat, K. 125 with Moshe Paranov conducting.

did.unittitle: Spring Choral Festival of Secondary Schools with Hartt Symphony Orchestra

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph recording of the Tenth Anniversary Spring Choral Festival of Secondary Schools, with the Hartt Symphony Orchestra on April 28, 1963 at the Bushnell Memorial Hall, performing Canticle of the Sun by Howard Boatwright, Song of Destiny by Johannes Brahms, and Magnificat by Dietrich Buxtehude with Moshe Paranov conducting.

did.unittitle: Spring Choral Festival of Secondary Schools with Hartt Symphony Orchestra

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph recording of the Spring Choral Festival of Secondary Schools, with the Hartt Symphony Orchestra on April 26, 1964 at the Bushnell Memorial Hall, performing Mass in G by Franz Schubert and Gloria by Francis Pouleng with Moshe Paranov conducting.

did.unittitle: Spring Choral Festival of Secondary Schools with Hartt Symphony Orchestra

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph recording of the Spring Choral Festival of Secondary Schools, with the Hartt Symphony Orchestra on April 28, 1968 at the Bushnell Memorial Hall, performing Mass in E Flat Major by Franz Schubert with Moshe Paranov conducting.

did.unittitle: Trinity Church Choir

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph recording Trinity Church Choir on December 24, 1956.

did.unittitle: Bertram Turetzky; Bertram Turetzky: The Virtuoso Doublebass

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the album Bertram Turetzky: The Virtuoso Doublebass released in 1965 by Medea Records (MCLP 1001), featuring Bert Turetzky (double bass), with assisting artists Nancy Turetzky (flute and alto flute), Daniel Kobialka (violin), and Tele Lesbines (percussion). The record cover includes a signed inscription from Bertram Turetzky to Moshe Paranov dated June 1966.

did.unittitle: McCoy Tyner and Jackie McLean; It's About Time

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the album It's About Time released in 1985 by Blue Note (BT 85102, LCCN 99576067), featuring McCoy Tyner and Jackie McLean (Hartt faculty).

did.unittitle: Bela Urban, Virginia Urban, and Marcel Hubert

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the album released by Classic Editions (CE 1005), featuring Hartt faculty members Bela Urban, Virginia Urban, and Marcel Hubert performing Sonata for Violin and Cello by Maurice Ravel, II Pleure Dans Mon Coeur by Claude Debussy, Second Sonata for Violin and Piano by Darius Milhaud, and Le Jardinier de Samos by Jacques Ibert.

did.unittitle: Bela Urban, Virginia Urban, and Simeon Bellison

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the album released by Classic Editions (CE 1002), featuring Bela Urban (Hartt faculty), Virginia Urban (Hartt faculty), and Simeon Bellison performing Trio for Clarinet, Violin, and Piano by Aram Khachaturian and Sonata for Violin and Piano by Maurice Ravel. The record cover includes a signed inscription from Bela Urban to Alfred Fuller.

did.unittitle: Aristid Von Wurtzler; Aristid von Wurtzler, Harpist

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the album Aristid von Wurtzler, Harpist released by American Stereophonic Corporation (ASCO A112), featuring Aristid von Wurtzler (harp – Hartt faculty).

did.unittitle: Donald Voorhees and the Symphony Orchestra; Music for Listening

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the album Music for Listening released by Allied Record Sales Company (LP-3001), featuring Donald Voorhees conducting a Symphony Orchestra.

did.unittitle: WCCC; University of Hartford SP07 Announcements

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of University of Hartford radio announcements recorded by WCCC. Contains cuts 1-14.

did.unittitle: William C. Willett and James Staples; Recital Music for Clarinet

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the album Recital Music for Clarinet released by Mark Educational Recordings (MRS 32638) in 1970, featuring William C. Willet (clarinet – Hartt faculty) and James Staples (piano). The record cover includes a signed inscription from Willett to Moshe Paranov.

did.unittitle: WTIC; Story of the Christ Child

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Four phonograph records of Story of the Christ Child recorded by WTIC.

did.unittitle: WTIC; Vincent Coffin's Address and Kinsella-Sharpe Hearing

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of Vincent Coffin's Address and the Kinsella-Sharpe Hearing recorded by WTIC, dated January 5, 1959.

did.unittitle: Youth String Orchestra

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phonograph record of the Youth String Orchestra performing at Carnegie Hall under the conduction of Moshe Paranov on March 30, 1952.

did.unittitle: Unidentified [Hartt Opera Theater Guild?]; Sister Angelica

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Seven phonograph records of a performance of Sister Angelica. This may be a Hartt Opera Guild production and could be a duplicate copy of their 1945 performance.

did.unittitle: Unidentified [Irene Kahn and/or Isadore Freed?]; Pooka Dance

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Three phonograph records of Pooka Dance. The original record sleeve was labelled with "Kahn," but the label on the first disc lists "Freed" as the recorder. It is not clear if, or which of, these names reflect the performer, owner, and/or recording engineer.

scopecontent.p: Contains three discs. One contains various songs and performers. The second features Julius Patzak and Gerhard Pechner. The third features Julius Patzak

did.unittitle: Music from the World of Romance
Mary Howard Recordings

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains two discs, the first Onelia Fineschi with EIAK under Gabriele Simionetti. The second has various songs (some unidentified).

did.unittitle: Freedom's People
Unidentified
Ephemera

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of ephemera such as programs, letters, notes, newspaper clippings, and pamphlets that were found inside record covers with the recordings. Record covers can be found in the Recordings series.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged in alphabetical order by the last name of the performer (or event name) of the recording in which the ephemera was found.

scopecontent.p: File contains a single record sleeve with an inscription to R. De Maria, signed by Ted Melyan. It is unclear which album was originally in this sleeve.

did.unittitle: New England Preparatory School Music Festival Chorus, with the Cambridge Festival Orchestra

Russell Oberlin and Joseph Iadone; John Dowland: Lute Songs

Theater of Melody
WTIC - University of Hartford Arts and Music Campaign
Your Box at the Opera
Duplicates

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of duplicate copies of recordings in the collection.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged alphabetically by the last name of the primary performer, or when appropriate by the primary ensemble or event name.
